abstract: With the Motorola proxy showdown set for Monday, billionaire financier Carl C. Icahn appears to have a new ally. ClearBridge Advisors, a money manager owned by brokerage firm Legg Mason, said it would support his bid for a seat on the cellphone maker’s board — something the company has adamantly opposed in a series of increasingly hard-edged announcements. “Given recent events at the company, we believe it is in the best interest of all shareholders to have a new representative on the board,” ClearBridge said in a press release. The firm did not say which “events” it had in mind, but Motorola has been struggling mightly in the past few months. In March, it slashed its revenue forecasts announced a management shake-up.
